channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street lights obscured by tree growth, 18th October
item.description:
Columns 3 and 19 on Oldfield Crescent are obscured by tree growth. Please could you arrange for them to be cleared? (Potentially some of the other lights too.)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Oldfield Crescent, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water flowing down footpath and across road, 18th October
item.description:
Water flows on the surface down the footpath between 35 & 37 Collum End Rise and across the road unless there has been a long period without rain. I understand there is a subsurface culvert under the footpath which is supposed to flow into the road drain. This is an ongoing problem which has allegedly been investigated before but not permanently fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Collum End Rise, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

Market street bridge, cheltenham

item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Tarmac on pavement uneven and breaking up., 18th October
item.description:
On the pavement outside 103 the tarmac is being broken up and raised due to buses and lorrys having to mount the pavement and then come off the dropped kerb due to obstructions which is leaving compressed tyre tracks and raised areas that need repairing asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Hesters Way Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: All drains are blocked below the surface level with grit, leaves etc and water runs over the top and causes flooding, 18th October
item.description:
Outside 49, 56,54,47,52 Noverton lane - there are at least 4 blocked and. That causes flooding further into village
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Noverton Lane, Noverton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsafe pavement between the telephone exchange and the 12 Bells, 18th October
item.description:
Water residue from blocked drains has made the pavement slippery and unsafe for walking, debris and algae left behind by the excess water. Highways have been on site today but core issue with drainage remains unsolved to my knowledge. Knock on effects for motorists, pedestrians and residents are persistently overlooked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Tree damaging fence at the back of 14/15 stanbury mews, 18th October
item.description:
There is a tree that rests against the fences of number 14/15 Stanbury Mews. It is breaking the fences, and it is causing problems with rats and dead leaves in our gardens. The tree needs cutting down please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdowne Court, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 18th October
item.description:
Possible unauthorised removal of trees and excavating of verge.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 18th October
item.description:
Tree fell and left a mound outside of 60cm on the verge.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath to The Old Cottage, Station Road, Bishops Cleeve, 18th October
item.description:
The footpath here has been encroached upon by steps and walls making it narrow and dangerous. I have been prompted to report this old issue because recently an elderly lady was nearly decapitated by a passing vehicles side mirror. It actually touched her hair. The road is narrow at this point making matters worse. You can often see children wheeling bikes and ladies with prams putting their lives at risk here. The trees to that property on Gotherington Lane also force people too near the traffic. A very dangerous place as anyone can clearly see.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Station Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Church lane from main road side of railwaybridge right up to Three Arches house. Multiple deep potholes, road surface disintegrating, 18th October
item.description:
From the main road side of church lane right up under railway bridge, past the church to the house Three Arches. The whole lanes is covered in potholes and difficult to drive without tyre damage

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prescott, Tewkesbury

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 18th October
item.description:
Customer reported tree outside house is very overgrown. Reaching onto his roof. Believes this presents a safety issue. Leaves piled up in the gullies, causing water damage and the ceiling fell in. House is currently uninhabitable.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole/drain cover makes loud noise when driven over. It’s a busy road, noise keeps us awake at night., 18th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5,6, Gotherington Lane, Tewkesbury
